Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates by stating that Rosa Parks' granddaughter has endorsed Trump, when in fact Rosa Parks did not have any children and the article is satire.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as it is based on a fake news story and there is no credible evidence to back up the endorsement claim.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that Rosa Parks' granddaughter exists and has made a political endorsement, even though there is no evidence to support this assumption.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Rosa Parks did not have any children, making it impossible for her to have a granddaughter.
Exist alternative explanation: An alternative explanation for the claim is that it is a fabricated story intended to shock readers and generate controversy.
